sagex.phoenix.metadata

Class MetadataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • sagex.phoenix.common.SystemConfigurationFileManager
      • sagex.phoenix.metadata.MetadataManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasFileConfigurations, SystemConfigurationFileManager.ConfigurationFileVisitor

    public class MetadataManager
extends SystemConfigurationFileManager
implements SystemConfigurationFileManager.ConfigurationFileVisitor
    Manages all Fanart/Metadata operations, from adding/removing providers, searching, updating, etc.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class sagex.phoenix.common.SystemConfigurationFileManager

      • getProviderForQuery

        public java.lang.String getProviderForQuery(SearchQuery query)
        Reads the MediaType from the query, and selects a provider(s) based on that. For each type, it will return the configured type from the configuration.

        Returns:

      • createQuery

        public SearchQuery createQuery(IMediaFile file,
                               Hints hints)
        Simply uses the SearchQueryFactory to create a basic query from a media file. By default, it will try to create a query using the existing metadata for Airings and Recorded TV Shows
        Parameters:
        file -
        Returns:

      • getMetdata

        public IMetadata getMetdata(IMetadataSearchResult result)
                     throws MetadataException
        for a given search result, return the metadata
        Parameters:
        result -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the metadata cannot be fetched
        MetadataException

      • getMetdata

        public IMetadata getMetdata(java.util.List<IMetadataSearchResult> results,
                            SearchQuery query)
                     throws MetadataException
        For a given list of search results, return the metadata for the best matched result. The SearchQuery is used to so that a best match can match on title, year, and not ONLY on the score.
        Parameters:
        results - List of search results
        query - the original search query.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the metadata cannot be fetched
        MetadataException

      • automaticUpdate

                            IMediaFile file,
                            SearchQuery query,
                            Hints options)
                     throws MetadataException

        file - IMediaFile instance
        query - SearchQuery query instance to use for searching
        options - IMetadataOptions any persistence options

      • canScanMediaFile

        public boolean canScanMediaFile(IMediaFile file,
                                Hints options)
        Return true if this file can be scanned. This will determine if the media can be scanned based on whether or not it fits the scannable media types and whether or not the media has been excluded based on the exclude filter.
        Parameters:
        file - IMediaFile to scan
        options -

      • isExcluded

        public boolean isExcluded(IMediaResource file)
        Returns true if the mediafile has been excluded based on the global exclude pattern
        Parameters:
        file -
        Returns:

      • getDefaultMetadataOptions

        public Hints getDefaultMetadataOptions()
        Returns the Default Metadata Options that will be used for scanning and persistence. These options are immutable, so you can change them in this instance, and it will NOT change the default options, except in this instance.
        Returns:
        Hints that contain one of Hints as defined in MetadataHints

      • importMediaFileAsRecording

        public boolean importMediaFileAsRecording(IMediaFile file)
        Imports a mediafile as a Recording so that it will show up in the Sage Recordings.

        This will handle importing Movies and TV shows into the recordings area.

        Parameters:
        file -

      • unimportMediaFileAsRecording

        public IMediaFile unimportMediaFileAsRecording(IMediaFile file)
        Takes a Recording, and it removes it as a Sage Recording, so that it will show up in the standard video library. This will actually have to delete the mediafile, physically, and then re-add it, in order to complete the task. This is a destructive operation.
        Parameters:
        file -
